metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1196 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
After a VR Process is destroyed, a reference to it may have been retained and used, leading to a use-after-free and potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.8 and Firefox ESR < 91.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1196` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
